snippet: A newly leaked Trans-Pacific Trade Partnership annex dated December 2014 reveals the Obama administration is no longer demanding protection for pharmaceutical prices.
abstract: Recently leaked section of proposed Trans-Pacific Partnership trade agreement reveals United States, facing headwinds from trading partners, is no longer demanding protection for pharmaceutical prices.

byline.contributor: Robert Pear contributed reporting from Washington and James Kanter from Strasbourg, France.

lead_paragraph: A newly leaked Trans-Pacific Trade Partnership annex dated December 2014 reveals the Obama administration is no longer demanding protection for pharmaceutical prices.

headline.main: U.S. Shifts Stance on Drug Pricing in Pacific Trade Pact Talks, Document Reveals
headline.print_headline: Leaked Section of Pacific Trade Pact Shows Shift in U.S. Stance on Drug Prices

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
